p: Three P. falciparum infections were performed. As an infection control, simultaneous infections of A. stephensi, which were reared at NIH, were performed, and the mean oocysts per mosquito in feedings #1, #2, and #3, were 56, 26, and 56, respectively, showing satisfactory uptake in the feeds. The results of two groups of A. gambiae, both of which were cultured at CDC and shipped to NIH for SMFA testing at the same time, are presented in Table 4.
